reviews.review_msg: The material in Chem 281 is very difficult, so don't expect the class to be a cake-walk (regardless of who teaches it). I found Dr. Samachetty very friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. Just go to office hours (barely anyone attends, so you can ask away!). Good luck - you wil need it...
Very rude, even in class, especially when inquired about something she has already said. Also, she shows little interest in the course. Midterms Hard, Final Terrible. AVOID

I've had her for a lab professor, she yelled at me for no reason what-so-ever =.= her instructions confused me..I went to her for help once..and she yelled at me telling me to look for my TAs during their office hours, but the thing is my TA doesn't have office hours..Would it kill her to help me with a quick question?

Nice person but thats not enough to make her a good prof. notes are very brief and not enough examples. the final exam was the ugliest thing i have ever seen and written in my life. just make sure you do well in the lab component. on the final just try to fill in every question to get part marks.my summer was hell,but i got a C- miraclously.
The most worthless chem professor ever. Her exams are IMPOSSIBLE. Don't even go over the textbook questions cause they are super easy compared to the exam questions. DON'T TAKE CHEM WITH HEMA.
What a waste of a summer semester. Horrible teaching , hard exams. bad curve, and not very approachable, plus she tests you on stuff that she doesnt go over.NOT RECOMMENDED
if you wanna hate ur life, if u wanna hate chemistry forever, take this class with hemma!!!!

PLEASE,PLEASE,PLEASE if you have a choice not to take this prof i strongly advise you to do so. Midterms extremely hard and second midterm average was 40 percent. The whole class practically failed. PLEASE AVOID TAKING THIS CLASS WITH HER!!!!
40% midterm average, and 80% students failure, but as long as u are above everyone else, you should be happy, helpfull prof, relatively clear... but u gotta practice to get the grade.

second midterm average 40%. 80% of the students failed...enough said. Don't think she knows what she's doing (except for ruining our GPA) Just reads her slides during the lecture...I wish she could stop squeaking in every other sentence. Avoid if possible!
She is a first year prof, and hasn't quite figured it out. Some serious problems with spacing things out.

problem sets were no use for the second midterm or for the final from what it looks like. all copied from 2006.. frist exam was relatively easy... second one had an average of 40% as 80% of the class failed... hmm yes great proff... when asked for harder problem sets, she refused because no1 does them apparently, and she was happy with the averge.
